intro: Sarcostemma brevistigma, commonly known as the small-stigma milkweed, is a climbing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by follicles containing numerous seeds. Its milky sap is toxic and contains cardiac glycosides, which can be harmful to animals and humans. Sarcostemma brevistigma is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
